light: Medium to bright indirect light. Avoid strong direct midday sun.
water: Water when the top 2–3 cm (1 in) of soil are dry; slightly less in winter.
humidity: Best at 50–70% relative humidity; tolerates 40–50% with slower growth.
soil: Chunky aroid mix: general potting soil with bark and perlite for drainage.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in spring and summer with a balanced liquid fertilizer at ¼–½ strength.
tips: Provide a moss pole or support for climbing types; wipe dust from leaves regularly.

light: Bright, indirect light; a little gentle morning sun is fine.
water: Water when top 3–5 cm (1–2 in) are dry; reduce slightly in low light.
humidity: Prefers 60–70% humidity; tolerates 45–50% indoors.
soil: Aroid mix: potting soil + bark + perlite for good aeration.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks during active growth; pause or reduce in winter.
tips: Train onto a stake or moss pole for larger, fenestrated leaves; rotate plant for even growth.

light: Low to bright indirect light; variegated types need brighter light.
water: Water when the top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; avoid waterlogged soil.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; grows lusher at 50–70%.
soil: Well-draining indoor mix; add perlite to improve drainage.
fertilizer: Feed monthly in spring and summer with a balanced fertilizer at ¼–½ strength.
tips: Tolerant and easy; great for hanging baskets or trellises, and easy to propagate from cuttings.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; avoid harsh direct sun.
water: Water when the top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; never let soil stay soggy.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; tolerates 40–50% indoors.
soil: Loose, well-draining mix with some peat or coco coir and perlite.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.
tips: Younger plants stay bushy; older plants can vine. Prune to keep compact or provide support to climb.

light: Low to medium indirect light; variegated types prefer medium to bright indirect.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; avoid wet, heavy soil.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; prefers 50–70% for best foliage.
soil: Standard potting mix with good drainage; avoid dense, soggy mixes.
fertilizer: Feed every 6–8 weeks in spring and summer with a balanced fertilizer.
tips: Very tolerant of low light; great for offices. Protect from cold drafts and sudden temperature drops.

light: Bright, indirect light; too little light reduces blooms.
water: Keep soil lightly moist; water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; avoid below 50% if possible.
soil: Chunky, airy mix: potting soil + bark + perlite, similar to orchid/aroid mix.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks with a balanced or bloom-boosting fertilizer at low strength.
tips: Increase humidity and light to encourage flowering; remove spent blooms and yellow leaves at the base.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; can tolerate low light with fewer flowers.
water: Keep soil evenly moist; water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; do not allow complete dry-out.
humidity: Best at 50–70% humidity; tolerates ~40% with some browning at tips.
soil: Rich, well-draining potting mix with good organic matter.
fertilizer: Feed every 6–8 weeks during growing season; flush soil occasionally to prevent salt buildup.
tips: Plant wilts visibly when thirsty—use this as an occasional indicator but avoid frequent severe wilting.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; avoids harsh direct midday sun.
water: Water when the top 4–5 cm (1.5–2 in) are dry; overwatering can cause root rot.
humidity: Comfortable at 35–55% humidity; higher humidity is tolerated but not required.
soil: Well-draining indoor mix; terracotta pots help prevent overwatering.
fertilizer: Feed every 6–8 weeks in spring and summer with a balanced fertilizer.
tips: Sensitive to fluoride and salts in tap water; use filtered or dechlorinated water if leaf tips brown.

light: Low to bright indirect light; tolerates some direct sun.
water: Allow soil to dry nearly completely between waterings; water sparingly in winter.
humidity: Handles low humidity (30–40%) well; no special humidity needed.
temp: Ideal 18–29°C (64–84°F); can tolerate down to ~10°C (50°F) if dry.
soil: Gritty, fast-draining cactus/succulent mix.
fertilizer: Feed lightly 2–3 times during the growing season with a low-dose fertilizer.
tips: Very tolerant plant; overwatering is the most common cause of decline.

light: Low to medium indirect light; tolerates low light very well.
water: Allow soil to dry at least 70–80% between waterings; rhizomes store water.
humidity: Comfortable at typical indoor humidity (30–50%).
soil: Well-draining mix with sand or perlite to avoid waterlogging.
fertilizer: Feed lightly 2–3 times during growing season; it is not a heavy feeder.
tips: Thrives on benign neglect; do not overwater or keep soil constantly wet.

light: Bright indirect light; some gentle morning sun encourages flowering.
water: Let top 3–5 cm (1–2 in) dry before watering; reduce in winter.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; many species tolerate 40–50% indoors.
soil: Chunky, well-aerated mix: soil + bark + perlite.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks during active growth; use a bloom-boosting fertilizer for flowering species.
toxicity: Generally non-toxic, but always check specific species.
tips: Do not remove old flower spurs; many Hoyas rebloom from the same spurs year after year.

light: F. lyrata)
water: images/plants/ficus.jpg
humidity: Bright indirect light; some species tolerate gentle direct sun.
temp: Water when top 3–5 cm (1–2 in) are dry; avoid letting soil stay soggy.
soil: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; large-leaved species prefer ~50–70%.
fertilizer: Ideal 18–29°C (64–84°F); avoid drafts and sudden temperature changes.
toxicity: Well-draining potting mix with some bark or perlite.
tips: Feed every 4–6 weeks during growing season with a balanced fertilizer.
column13: Sap can be irritating; plants are often considered mildly toxic.
column14: Does not like being moved frequently; rotate slowly and keep in a stable environment to prevent leaf drop.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; avoid scorching sun.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; keep slightly more moist in brighter conditions.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; may show brown tips below 40%.
soil: Well-draining indoor mix with some peat or coco coir.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in spring and summer.
tips: Pinch or prune to keep compact; provide a support if you want a climbing growth habit.

light: Bright to medium indirect light; tolerates lower light with slower growth.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; do not let soil stay waterlogged.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; appreciates 50–70% for best leaf tips.
soil: Rich, well-draining potting mix.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks during the growing season.
tips: Sensitive to fluoride and salts; if tips brown, try filtered water and occasional leaching.

light: Low to medium indirect light; avoid hot direct sun.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; slightly more in brighter, warmer rooms.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; benefits from 50–70% in dry homes.
soil: Well-draining potting mix with some peat and perlite.
fertilizer: Feed lightly every 6–8 weeks in spring and summer.
tips: Remove yellowing fronds at the base; avoid overfertilizing, which can burn roots and leaves.

light: Bright, indirect light; avoid direct midday sun.
water: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged; never allow root ball to fully dry.
humidity: Prefers high humidity: 60–80%; may decline below ~50%.
temp: Ideal 16–24°C (61–75°F); avoid hot, dry air and cold drafts.
soil: Moisture-retentive but airy mix with peat or coco coir and perlite.
fertilizer: Feed lightly every 4–6 weeks in growing season with a diluted fertilizer.
tips: Excellent in bathrooms or near humidifiers; trim old fronds regularly to encourage new growth.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; avoid direct sun.
water: Keep soil evenly moist; water when top 1–2 cm (½–1 in) are just starting to dry.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; avoid dry air below 50% if possible.
soil: Rich, well-draining mix that holds moisture.
fertilizer: Feed lightly monthly during warm months; do not overfertilize.
tips: Avoid watering directly into the crown to prevent rot; do not prune the central rosette.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; no direct sun.
water: Keep soil lightly moist; water when top 1–2 cm (½–1 in) feel dry.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; many species struggle below 50%.
soil: Light, airy mix with peat/coco and plenty of perlite.
fertilizer: Feed monthly at low strength during growing season.
tips: Use filtered or dechlorinated water to reduce leaf browning; keep away from drafts and heating vents.

light: Medium, indirect light; too much light can fade patterns.
water: Keep soil consistently lightly moist; allow top 1–2 cm (½–1 in) to dry slightly.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; may crisp at humidity below ~50%.
soil: Loose, well-draining mix with organic matter and perlite.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in spring and summer at half strength.
tips: Avoid cold water and cold drafts; leaves fold up at night as a normal behavior.

light: Bright indirect light; no direct sun.
water: Keep soil evenly moist, not soggy; let top 1–2 cm (½–1 in) dry slightly.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; struggles below ~50%.
soil: Light, airy mix similar to Calathea (peat/coco + perlite).
fertilizer: Feed lightly every 4–6 weeks in growing season.
tips: Sensitive to low humidity and tap water; use filtered water and provide extra humidity.

light: Medium, indirect light; avoid strong direct sun.
water: Keep soil slightly moist; allow top 1–2 cm (½–1 in) to dry between waterings.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; avoid very dry air.
soil: Loose, airy medium rich in organic matter.
fertilizer: Feed lightly every 4–6 weeks in the growing season.
tips: Keep conditions stable; avoid cold drafts and sudden environmental changes.

light: Bright, indirect light; some tolerate gentle morning sun.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; likes even moisture but not soggy soil.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; can tolerate ~50% with slower growth.
soil: Rich, well-draining mix with bark and perlite.
fertilizer: Feed every 4 weeks during active growth; reduce heavily in winter.
tips: May go semi-dormant in winter; reduce watering and avoid repotting during rest periods.

light: Bright, indirect to gentle direct light; indoors often needs strong light.
water: Keep soil consistently moist; do not allow to dry completely.
humidity: Prefers 60–80% humidity; appreciates extra humidity indoors.
soil: Rich, moisture-retentive but well-draining mix.
fertilizer: Feed every 2–4 weeks in growing season with a balanced fertilizer.
tips: Large, thirsty plants; use bigger pots and monitor water closely indoors.

light: Bright, indirect light; tolerates medium light.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; do not let soil stay soggy.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; prefers 50–70% for best foliage.
soil: Rich, well-draining potting mix.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in spring and summer.
toxicity: Highly toxic if ingested; sap can irritate skin.
tips: Rotate plant regularly to keep stems straight; prune tall canes to encourage branching.

light: Bright indirect light; tolerates some gentle direct sun.
water: Water when top 3–5 cm (1–2 in) are dry; avoid constantly wet soil.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; tolerant of typical indoor levels.
soil: Well-draining potting mix; avoid compact, heavy soils.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in growing season.
tips: Pinch or prune back to maintain bushy shape; provide support if grown tall.

light: Very bright indirect light; some direct sun to maintain strong color.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; do not allow complete dry-out.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; may drop leaves in dry air.
temp: Ideal 20–27°C (68–81°F); very sensitive to cold drafts.
soil: Rich, well-draining potting mix.
fertilizer: Feed every 4 weeks during active growth.
toxicity: Toxic if ingested; sap can irritate skin.
tips: Avoid sudden changes in light or temperature; crotons are prone to leaf drop when stressed.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; avoid strong direct sun.
water: Allow top 2–3 cm (1 in) to dry; many species dislike constantly wet roots.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; some species appreciate higher humidity.
soil: Well-draining mix; some species prefer slightly succulent-like soils.
fertilizer: Feed lightly every 4–6 weeks in growing season at low strength.
tips: Compact and slow-growing; excellent for shelves and small spaces. Avoid overpotting.

light: images/plants/pilea.jpg
water: Bright indirect light; avoid harsh midday sun.
humidity: Water when the top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; slightly less in winter.
temp: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; prefers 50–70% for best growth.
fertilizer: Well-draining indoor mix with perlite.
toxicity: Feed every 4–6 weeks in spring and summer.
tips: Generally considered non-toxic.
column13: Rotate plant for even shape; pups can be separated and repotted easily.

light: Bright, indirect light; avoid intense direct sun.
water: Keep soil lightly moist; allow top 1–2 cm (½–1 in) to dry between waterings.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; avoid water sitting on leaves.
temp: Ideal 18–24°C (64–75°F); sensitive to cold and drafts.
soil: Light, airy mix with good drainage (soil + perlite + some bark).
fertilizer: Feed every 4 weeks during growth with a balanced or high-potassium fertilizer.
toxicity: Some types mildly toxic; avoid ingestion.
tips: Avoid overhead watering; water at soil level to prevent leaf spots and fungal issues.

light: Bright, indirect light; avoid direct sun on leaves.
water: Keep soil evenly moist but never waterlogged; water when top feels slightly dry.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; avoid very dry air.
soil: Special African violet mix or light, airy potting mix.
fertilizer: Feed with a violet-specific fertilizer at low strength regularly in growth.
tips: Avoid cold water on leaves; bottom-watering or wick systems work well.

light: Bright, indirect light; avoid strong midday sun indoors.
water: Keep soil lightly moist; allow top 1–2 cm (½–1 in) to dry before watering again.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; may shed needles in very dry air.
soil: Well-draining potting mix with organic matter.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks during growing season.
toxicity: Toxic to pets if ingested; sap may irritate skin.
tips: Good for hanging baskets; old stems can be pruned to promote fresh growth.

light: images/plants/chamaerops.jpg
water: Bright light; some direct sun is usually appreciated indoors.
humidity: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; do not let soil stay soggy.
soil: Ideal 18–27°C (64–81°F); some species tolerate cooler temps.
fertilizer: Well-draining palm mix or general potting mix with sand.
toxicity: Feed lightly during spring and summer with palm fertilizer or balanced feed.
tips: Most palms are considered non-toxic, but always verify species.
column13: Provide as much light as possible indoors; remove spent fronds at the base.

light: Bright light; several hours of direct sun are ideal indoors.
water: Water when at least half the pot depth is dry; very drought tolerant.
humidity: Comfortable at typical indoor humidity (~30–50%).
temp: Ideal 18–29°C (64–84°F); can tolerate cooler conditions if kept dry.
soil: Very well-draining gritty mix; cactus mix with added sand or perlite works well.
fertilizer: Feed lightly 2–3 times during the growing season.
tips: Use a heavy pot to stabilize tall plants; avoid overwatering, particularly in low light.

light: Bright, indirect light; tolerates medium light.
water: Water when top 3–5 cm (1–2 in) are dry; likes even moisture but not soggy soil.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; appreciates 50–70% for best health.
soil: Well-draining mix; avoid heavy clay soils.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in spring and summer, lightly.
tips: Rotate regularly for straight growth; avoid frequent changes in location or watering pattern.

light: images/plants/crassula.jpg
water: Bright light; several hours of direct sun indoors are ideal.
humidity: Allow soil to dry out almost completely before watering; water thoroughly then drain.
soil: Ideal 18–26°C (64–79°F); cooler (10–15°C / 50–59°F) in winter can encourage blooming.
fertilizer: Coarse, fast-draining succulent/cactus mix.
toxicity: Feed sparingly, 1–2 times during growing season with succulent fertilizer.
tips: Mildly toxic if ingested.
column13: Avoid overwatering and poor drainage; prune to maintain shape and encourage branching.

light: Bright light; at least a few hours of direct sun daily.
water: Allow soil to dry thoroughly before watering; water more often in peak summer, far less in winter.
humidity: Comfortable at low humidity (~30–50%).
temp: Ideal 18–27°C (64–81°F); can tolerate slightly cooler if dry.
soil: Cactus/succulent mix with excellent drainage.
fertilizer: Feed lightly 1–2 times during the growing season with a low-nitrogen fertilizer.
toxicity: Some species mildly toxic if ingested; gel of Aloe vera is used medicinally but outer leaf can irritate.
tips: Ensure pot has drainage; avoid cold, wet soil which can cause root rot.

light: Bright indirect to some direct sun; avoids very harsh midday sun behind glass.
water: Allow soil to dry almost completely between waterings; water more in summer, very little in winter.
humidity: Comfortable at low humidity (~30–50%).
temp: Ideal 18–26°C (64–79°F); can tolerate cooler if kept dry.
soil: Cactus/succulent mix with extra grit or pumice.
fertilizer: Feed lightly once or twice during the growing season.
tips: Compact and slow-growing; excellent for desks and small spaces. Avoid water sitting in rosettes for extended periods.

light: Very bright light; several hours of direct sun indoors are ideal.
water: Allow soil to dry completely before watering; water thoroughly, then drain well.
humidity: Comfortable at low humidity (~30–50%).
soil: Gritty, fast-draining cactus/succulent mix.
fertilizer: Feed very sparingly 1–2 times during growing season.
tips: Avoid water on leaves to prevent rot; needs strong light to maintain compact rosettes and good color.

light: Bright light; some direct sun helps flowering and compact growth.
water: Water when top half of the soil is dry; avoid constant moisture.
humidity: Comfortable at low to medium humidity (30–60%).
soil: Well-draining succulent mix.
fertilizer: Feed lightly during growing and flowering season.
toxicity: Many species mildly toxic if ingested.
tips: Deadhead spent blooms to encourage new ones; provide bright light to avoid legginess.

light: Bright, indirect light; tolerates some direct early or late sun.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; slightly more during active growth and flowering.
humidity: Prefers 40–60% humidity; tolerates a bit higher.
temp: Ideal 18–24°C (64–75°F) during growth; slightly cooler (10–15°C / 50–59°F) can help set buds.
soil: Well-draining mix with some organic matter and perlite.
fertilizer: Feed every 4 weeks during growing season; stop or reduce after flowering.
tips: Avoid sudden changes in light and temperature, which can cause bud drop.

light: Medium to bright indirect light; avoid strong direct sun.
water: Keep soil lightly moist, allowing top 2–3 cm (1 in) to dry between waterings.
humidity: Prefers 50–70% humidity; tolerant of average indoor levels.
soil: Well-draining mix: cactus soil mixed with peat or coco for moisture retention.
fertilizer: Feed lightly every 4–6 weeks in growing season.
tips: Epiphytic cactus; appreciates slightly more moisture and humidity than desert cacti.

light: Bright, indirect light; some tolerate gentle direct sun. Lower light reduces color.
water: Water when top 2–3 cm (1 in) are dry; avoid staying soggy.
humidity: Comfortable at 40–60% humidity; tolerates typical indoor ranges.
soil: Regular potting mix with good drainage.
fertilizer: Feed every 4–6 weeks in growing season.
toxicity: Some species mildly toxic; can cause mild irritation if ingested.
tips: Prune regularly to prevent legginess and encourage bushier growth; cuttings root easily in water.

light: Low to medium indirect light; tolerates very low light.
water: Water when top 3–5 cm (1–2 in) are dry; very tolerant of occasional drought.
humidity: Comfortable at 30–60% humidity; no special humidity required.
soil: Standard potting mix with reasonable drainage.
fertilizer: Feed sparingly 2–3 times per year; slow grower.
tips: Very durable, low-maintenance plant; avoid overwatering and heavy fertilization.
